pr_title: DROOLS-5384: Clicking rightmost column's header in DMN decision table raises an error

timeline.message: DROOLS-5384: Clicking rightmost column's header in DMN decision table raises an error

timeline.bodyText:
I am curious when this should occur?
How is it possible for candidateHeaderColumnIndex to exceed the number of columns?
timeline.author: manstis

replies.bodyText: Yes, could you please explain a little bit. Just we are sure we do not cause index out of bounds exception somewhere else.
replies.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText:
When you double-click the last cell in a header and the first cell is hidden (scrolled).
This didn't happened before because the last header cell was not "clickable" when we had the "Description" column.
replies.author: danielzhe

replies.bodyText:
So the issue is that the headerColumnIndex is wrong?
Where is the getHeaderBlockEndColumnIndex(..) method called from? How was the parameter value derived?
replies.author: manstis

replies.bodyText:
Is called here: 
  
    
      appformer/uberfire-extensions/uberfire-wires/uberfire-wires-core/uberfire-wires-core-grids/src/main/java/org/uberfire/ext/wires/core/grids/client/util/CellContextUtilities.java
    
    
         Line 98
      in
      331f358
    
    
    
    

        
          
           final int blockEndColumnIndex = ColumnIndexUtilities.getHeaderBlockEndColumnIndex(gridColumns, 
        
    
  


In my opinion this fix is correct, because ColumnIndexUtilities already "fixes" the candidateHeaderColumnIndex to a valid value in other situations.
replies.author: danielzhe

replies.bodyText: I'm not convinced it is the correct fix; however I was unable to debug in GWT (wozza, is it just me or has GWT development taken a performance turn for the worse recently!?!?!?) I still believe candidateHeaderColumnIndex should not exceed the number of columns in the grid. However this PR fixes the issue and therefore so as not to stand in the way of progress I'll approve....
replies.author: manstis

replies.bodyText:
For me the performance is the same. :D
I still think the fix is the correct, because if you trace back the candidateHeaderColumnIndex comes from ci.getUiColumnIndex(). I think the uiColumnIndex() is right and the logic is good since ColumnIndexUtilities.getHeaderBlockEndColumnIndex() in my understands have the job of get the logical end block column index for that specific UI column.
replies.author: danielzhe

replies.bodyText: Sure, but ci.getUiColumnIndex() should NEVER be greater than the gridModel.getColumns().size() - 1 otherwise something has gone wrong somewhere else...
replies.author: manstis

timeline.message: DROOLS-5384: Cover all indexes above columns count
